[Taiwan](/wiki/Buddhism_in_Taiwan) - [Thailand](/wiki/Buddhism_in_Thailand) - [Tibet](/wiki/Tibetan_Buddhism) - [Vietnam](/wiki/Buddhism_in_Vietnam) - Buddhism portal - v - t - e **Hua Giam Si** ([traditional Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 華嚴禪寺; [simplified Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 华严禅寺), is a [Buddhist](/wiki/Buddhist) monastery in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The center was originally set up by Venerable Zhen Ding. The present premises are located at [Geylang](/wiki/Geylang), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## Overview Hua Giam Si was founded in 2000 by Venerable Zhen Ding. The temple is inspired by the [Huayan school](/wiki/Huayan_school) of [Chinese Buddhism](/wiki/Chinese_Buddhism) and the [Koyasan](/wiki/Koyasan) [Shingon](/wiki/Shingon_Buddhism) tradition of [Japanese Buddhism](/wiki/Japanese_Buddhism). It enshrines statues of: - [Mahavairocana](/wiki/Mahavairocana) - [Mahamayuri](/wiki/Mahamayuri) - [Guanyin](/wiki/Guanyin) - [Bhaisajyaguru](/wiki/Bhaisajyaguru) - The [Twelve Heavenly Generals](/wiki/Twelve_Heavenly_Generals) - [Ksitigarbha](/wiki/K%E1%B9%A3itigarbha) - [Sūryaprabha](/wiki/S%C5%ABryaprabha) - [Candraprabha](/wiki/Candraprabha) - [Buddhism in Singapore](/wiki/Buddhism_in_Singapore) - Official website This article about a [Buddhist](/wiki/Buddhist) place of worship is a stub.
